attributes.action: Keep places of exercise open during The 2nd lockdown
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the levels of stress caused by lockdown and isolation.
To keep the economy of sport running, to keep people working. 
To look after the welfare of children in school who rely on their passions to destress. 
Maintain the social aspect of sport in a safe environment. 
Maintain and improve health of people and children.
attributes.background: To keep gyms and sports clubs open during lockdown

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
